column4: hi does anyone know how to simulate gnome events through the command?
e.g mute, volume up, shutdown etc?
anyone know how to turn volume up through the command line?
alsamixer just change the volume of the system through the back
i have media keys that turn the volume up and down
i want to find out how to do that through the command line
i'm trying to set up my remote control to turn gnome volume up and down
admittedly the output is a bit cryptic at first   it 0x"hex number here"

a4 is the hexidecimal output of the key you pressed    so you can find the key code that the system sees.   you can use that info to either make a script for doing the same thing   or change the keymap to have that key do things...   the possiblities are many
I don't think you understand me right. right now say for example xf86audiomute is set to mute audio in gnome
if you don't want to use that key to do this.  only want a command to mute it.   asoundconf  can probably do that.    i just install aumix and use it.     aumix -v 0
yea i read about that, but I just want to see if there is anyway to send commands to the gnome desktop environment via a command line
then you need to be looking at metacity  and dbus ?
like i said look into metacity    i don't do gnome
and you were correct,  i did misread what you wanted.    being a console user i think a little differently than the avarage ubunteer
